author: Reuters Editorial
description: U.S. President Donald Trump told South Korea's presidential envoy that Washington was willing to resolve the North Korean nuclear crisis through engagement under the right conditions, South Korea's Yonhap News Agency reported on Thursday.
title: Trump willing to use engagement on North Korea crisis: South Korea envoy

author: Christine Kim
description: South Korea said on Wednesday it wanted to reopen communications with North Korea as new President Moon Jae-in seeks a two-track policy involving sanctions and dialogue with its reclusive neighbor to rein in its nuclear and missile programs.
title: South Korea says it wants to reopen communications with North amid missile crisis

author: Claire Reid
description: His comments come after North Korea launched a successful test missile on Sunday.
title: US Admiral Calls North Korea's Actions A 'Recipe For Disaster' | LADbible

author: KAORI HITOMI
description: TOKYO (AP) — The top American military officer in the Pacific said Wednesday that North Korea's recent military actions are "a recipe for a disaster" and warned against a sense of complacency in the face of increasing tensions on the Korean Peninsula. Adm. Harry Harris Jr. made the remarks at a lecture for a Tokyo think tank after meeting with Japanese leaders that he said focused on North Korea's missile and nuclear programs. North Korea test-launched a missile on Sunday that many experts believe could be its most advanced yet, flying higher and longer than any previous missile.
title: US admiral: North Korea's actions 'recipe for disaster'

description: TOKYO (AP) — The top American military officer in the Pacific says North Korea's recent military actions are "a recipe for a disaster" and is warning against a sense of complacency in the face of increasing tensions on the Korean Peninsula.
title: US admiral: North Korea's actions 'recipe for disaster'

author: Narae Kim
description: Investors may be glued to the latest political turmoil in Washington, but there’s a long-present danger that’s now looming larger for some analysts: North Korea.
title: Trump Aside, It May Be Time for Markets to Worry About North Korea

author: John Hayward
description: North Korea has been working on a patent for producing sodium cyanide, which can be used in nerve gas, with the help of a U.N. agency.
title: Report: U.N. Agency Is Helping North Korea with Patent for Nerve Gas Component

author: Choe Sang-Hun, Paul Mozur, Nicole Perlroth and David E. Sanger
description: Since the 1980s, North Korea has been known to train cadres of digital soldiers to engage in electronic warfare. Now this force is under scrutiny.
title: Focus Turns to North Korea Sleeper Cells as Possible Culprits in Cyberattack

author: John Hayward
description: On Wednesday, South Korean President Moon Jae-in said “there is a high possibility of a military conflict” with North Korea.
title: South Korean President Moon: ‘High Possibility’ of Military Conflict with North Korea - Breitbart

author: EDITH M. LEDERER
description: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — U.S. Ambassador Nikki Haley accused North Korea on Tuesday of intimidating the entire international community with its nuclear program, military ability and cyberattacks, and said any country that doesn't implement U.N. sanctions is supporting Pyongyang's actions. "No one is immune to the threat of North Korea," she told reporters before emergency closed-door consultations by the U.N. Security Council on the North's weekend ballistic missile launch, which experts said demonstrated a significant technological jump with the rocket flying higher and for a longer period of time.
title: US envoy: North Korea is intimidating the entire world
